text:
What is logged as

61.219.37.13 - - [05/Feb/2008:21:11:31 -0800] "GET / HTTP/1.0" 200 604 "-"
"WWWOFFLE/2.9a"

Is in fact

$ wwwoffle -O transgender-taiwan.org
HTTP/1.0 301 Moved Permanently
Date: Wed, 06 Feb 2008 05:11:31 GMT
Server: Apache/2.0.61 (Unix) PHP/4.4.7 mod_ssl/2.0.61 OpenSSL/0.9.7e
mod_fastcgi/2.4.2 DAV/2 SVN/1.4.2
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.2.3
Vary: Accept-Encoding,Cookie
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Cache-Control: private, must-revalidate, max-age=0
Last-Modified: Wed, 06 Feb 2008 05:11:32 GMT
Location: http://transgender-taiwan.org/index.php?title=%E9%A6%96%E9%A0%81
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
X-Cache: MISS from sys1-d13-1-c1,MISS from sys1-d13-1-p1,MISS from sys1-p1-130
Connection: close
Proxy-Connection: close

I.e., you return 301 to the sender, but log 200 in the logs!
You do indeed sometimes log 301s, but no in any of my MediaWiki site logs.
creator: jidanni@jidanni.org
rpluem@apache.org
text:
Please provide your httpd configuration and let us know who creates the 301
(httpd, some script (php, cgi whatever))

creator: jidanni@jidanni.org
text: Sorry. This turns out to be Dreamhost specific. See the above URL. Closing.
